page.title: 07THE OYSTER FARMS
page.content: The oyster farms are managed by Ray Castell.The site is an intermediate stage in the process culture of oysters.In West Stall they have a hatchery,they breed from them,and collect millions of eggs and sperm bring them together as small larvae.That is the first stage in breeding oysters.Later in a couple of weeks,the oysters will cease moving and will settle on a firm surface.At that stage it will become a tiny oyster about the size of a pinhead.Oysters when, they come here, are about six mm in length.Lakes and resevoirs of food are here and they contain microscopic plants,such as algae which grows more densely than in the sea.
